Dispute_Type: Genuine marriage vs. sham marriage for immigration purposes
Legal_Issue: Whether the marriage is genuine or entered into primarily for immigration benefits
Decision_Level: Appeal Division of the Immigration and Refugee Board
Credibility_Assessment: Inconsistencies in evidence regarding relationship timeline and communication
Evidence_Type: Marriage certificate, communication records, testimony on relationship history
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Unexplained acquisition of marriage certificate, contradictory communication evidence, prior relationship
Proceeding_Type: Administrative appeal followed by judicial review
Decision_Maker: Immigration and Refugee Board, Appeal Division
Legal_Standard: Burden of proof on applicant to demonstrate genuine marriage
Application_Factor: Timing of marriage, nature of prior relationships, credibility of interactions
Decision_Outcome: Marriage not proven genuine; sponsorship denied
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of the Board's credibility findings
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Immigration Act â€“ requirements for genuine spousal relationship
Outcome_of_Review: No certification of general importance; review dismissed
Cause_of_Refusal: Suspicion of sham marriage for immigration benefits
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistent accounts, lack of corroborating communication evidence
Document_Fraud: Suspicion regarding authenticity or procurement of marriage certificate
Credibility_Issues: Contradictory statements about relationship development and contact
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim that marriage was genuine despite limited contact and timing issues
Omission_Type: Failure to provide consistent and credible evidence of marital relationship
